title: Acme Corp - Volume Discount Not Applied
description: Customer qualified for 15% volume discount but was billed at standard rate for Q3 invoices
rootCause: Volume tier threshold not updated after contract renewal
aiExplanation: The system detected that Acme Corp exceeded the 500-unit threshold in August but the volume discount was not triggered for September and October invoices.

title: TechFlow Inc - Price List Override on API Gateway
description: API Gateway billed at $12.50/unit instead of contracted $10.00/unit for 4,160 units over two months
rootCause: Price list version mismatch after Q3 product catalog update
aiExplanation: Following the October product catalog refresh, TechFlow's contracted rate for API Gateway was overwritten with the standard list price. This affected 4,160 units across November and December invoices.

title: DataSync Solutions - Duplicate Invoice for November
description: Two identical invoices generated for DataSync's November billing cycle totaling double the expected amount
rootCause: Billing system retry mechanism generated a second invoice after timeout error
aiExplanation: A billing system timeout on December 1st triggered an automatic retry that created a duplicate invoice. Both invoices INV-2024-0960 and INV-2024-0961 have identical line items and amounts of $30,000.

notes.author: Emily Watson
notes.text: Confirmed with engineering - timeout caused retry. Credit memo in progress.

activityLog.detail: Verified duplicate with billing system logs

title: CloudBase Ltd - Infrastructure Discount Exceeds Approval Limit
description: A 30% discount was applied to CloudBase's Infrastructure-as-Code line item, exceeding the 25% maximum without VP approval
rootCause: Sales rep manually overrode discount without completing approval workflow
aiExplanation: CloudBase's contract specifies a 25% maximum discount for Infrastructure-as-Code. However, a 30% discount has been applied since contract inception in January 2024, resulting in $150,000 in excess discounts over 12 months at $66,667/month billing.

title: Pinnacle Financial - SLA Credit Not Issued for September Outage
description: September platform outage exceeded SLA thresholds but no service credit was issued to Pinnacle
rootCause: SLA breach notification was not routed to the billing team for credit issuance
aiExplanation: Pinnacle's contract guarantees 99.95% uptime. September availability was 99.82%, triggering a 50% monthly credit. The $75,000 monthly fee should have generated a $37,500 credit, but no credit memo was created.

notes.author: James Rodriguez
notes.text: Credit memo CM-2024-0042 issued and applied to October invoice.

activityLog.detail: Full amount recovered via credit memo

title: NexGen Retail - Promotional Rate Applied After Expiry
description: NexGen is still receiving the 30% launch promotional rate that expired in August 2024
rootCause: Promotional pricing end date was not configured in the billing system
aiExplanation: NexGen received a 30% promotional discount for the first 6 months (Feb-Jul 2024). The promotion expired August 1st, but the discount continues to be applied, resulting in $9,000/month leakage for September through November.

title: Verdant Health - Missed October Billing Cycle
description: No invoice was generated for Verdant Health Systems for October despite active contract
rootCause: Customer record was temporarily deactivated during a CRM data migration
aiExplanation: During the CRM migration on September 28th, Verdant's customer record was marked inactive for 48 hours. The October 1st billing run skipped the account, and it was not caught until the monthly reconciliation.

notes.author: Emily Watson
notes.text: Catch-up invoice INV-2024-0935 generated and sent to customer.

title: Pinnacle Financial - Commission Double-Paid on Renewal
description: Sales rep received both new-business and renewal commission on the Pinnacle Data Warehouse renewal
rootCause: Contract renewal was incorrectly classified as new business in the CRM
aiExplanation: The Pinnacle Data Warehouse contract (CON-010) was a renewal of a prior agreement but was tagged as 'New Business' in Salesforce, triggering a 12% new-deal commission instead of the 4% renewal rate on a $420,000 contract.

activityLog.detail: Reviewing CRM deal classification with sales ops

title: DataSync Solutions - Revenue Recognized Before Delivery
description: Integration consulting revenue for DataSync was recognized in Q3 before project milestones were delivered
rootCause: Milestone completion dates were entered incorrectly in the project management system
aiExplanation: Three integration milestones totaling $4,500 were marked as delivered in August, but actual delivery confirmation emails show completion in October. Revenue was recognized prematurely under ASC 606.

notes.author: James Rodriguez
notes.text: Working with accounting to reverse and re-recognize in correct period.

title: Streamline Logistics - Usage Metering Discrepancy
description: Billed API calls are 18% lower than metered usage for Streamline's Fleet Management platform
rootCause: Metering pipeline has a data lag causing undercount at billing cutoff
aiExplanation: Metered usage logs show 2.4M API calls in October and November, but the billing system only captured 1.97M calls. The 18% gap exceeds the 3% threshold and appears to be caused by a 6-hour data pipeline delay at month-end cutoff.

title: Atlas Manufacturing - Contract Billed Past End Date
description: Atlas's IoT Platform contract ended January 31, 2025 but billing continued through February
rootCause: Auto-renewal flag was set but customer had opted out; billing system did not reflect the opt-out
aiExplanation: Atlas Manufacturing notified the account team in November that they would not renew. However, the auto-renewal cancellation was not processed in the billing system, and the February invoice was generated at the $25,000 monthly rate.

title: BrightPath Education - Subscription Downgrade Without Proration
description: BrightPath downgraded from Enterprise to Standard tier mid-month but no prorated credit was issued
rootCause: Subscription management system does not auto-calculate mid-cycle proration
aiExplanation: BrightPath downgraded their LMS license from Enterprise ($13,000/mo) to Standard ($8,500/mo) on October 15th. The full Enterprise rate was charged for October with no $4,200 prorated credit.

title: Quantum Dynamics - Bundle Discount Miscalculation
description: Quantum's HPC bundle discount calculated at 12% instead of the contracted 8%, resulting in revenue leakage
rootCause: Bundle discount configuration error in CPQ system
aiExplanation: The CPQ system applied a 12% bundle discount to Quantum's 3-product bundle instead of the contracted 8%. At $24,000/month over the March-December period, this creates a $960/month variance totaling $19,400 across affected invoices.

title: Apex Consulting - Commission Rate Override
description: Account executive's commission rate was manually overridden from 8% to 14% without approval
rootCause: Commission plan override applied during Q2 SPIFF but not reverted after program ended
aiExplanation: During the Q2 sales SPIFF program (April-June), the AE's commission rate was elevated to 14%. The override was not reverted, and July through November commissions on the $432,000 Apex contract were paid at the inflated rate.

notes.author: Sarah Chen
notes.text: Confirmed with Sales Comp team. Rate should have reverted July 1. Clawback in process.

activityLog.detail: Commission clawback approved by VP Sales

title: Ironclad Security - Cancelled Subscription Still Billing
description: Ironclad cancelled their Incident Response add-on in September but was billed for October and November
rootCause: Cancellation request was processed in CRM but not propagated to the billing system
aiExplanation: Ironclad submitted a cancellation for the Incident Response module effective September 30. The CRM shows cancellation confirmed, but the billing system continued to charge $7,150/month for the module in October and November.

title: GreenField Agriculture - Tax Calculation Error
description: Wrong tax jurisdiction applied to GreenField invoices, undercharging sales tax
rootCause: Customer shipping address used instead of billing address for tax jurisdiction lookup
aiExplanation: GreenField's billing address is in Texas (8.25% sales tax) but the system is using their Iowa warehouse address (6% sales tax) for tax calculation. The 2.25% difference on $7,000/month creates a $157.50/month undercharge.

activityLog.detail: Validating tax jurisdiction with customer records

title: Horizon Media - Unbilled Content Delivery Overages
description: Horizon exceeded their CDN bandwidth allocation by 40% in October but overage charges were not applied
rootCause: Overage billing threshold was set to 50% instead of the contracted 10%
aiExplanation: Horizon's contract includes 50TB CDN bandwidth with overages billed at $0.08/GB above 110% utilization. October usage reached 70TB (140%), but the billing system threshold was incorrectly set to 150%, so no overage invoice was generated.

notes.author: Emily Watson
notes.text: Overage invoice generated. Customer acknowledged and paid. Threshold corrected.

title: Mosaic Design - Feature Entitlement Mismatch
description: Mosaic is being billed for Premium Asset Management features not included in their Standard tier
aiExplanation: Initial detection flagged Premium Asset Management features on Mosaic's Standard tier invoice. Investigation revealed that a verbal upgrade agreement was in place but not yet documented. This is not a leakage case.

notes.author: Michael Torres
notes.text: Customer confirmed verbal upgrade. Contract amendment in progress. Marking as false positive.

title: Acme Corp - Unbilled Professional Services
description: 40 hours of professional services delivered to Acme in Q4 have not been invoiced
rootCause: Time entries not submitted by consulting team before billing cutoff
aiExplanation: Professional services records show 40 hours of ETL Connector development delivered in November at $825/hour. No corresponding invoice exists. The unbilled amount of $33,000 exceeds the 30-day billing window threshold.

title: Silverline Telecom - Currency Conversion Variance
description: EUR to USD conversion on Silverline invoices deviates from contracted fixed exchange rate
rootCause: Billing system used spot FX rate instead of contracted fixed rate
aiExplanation: Silverline's contract specifies a fixed EUR/USD rate of 1.08. The August and September invoices used spot rates of 1.102 and 1.095 respectively, resulting in a combined variance of $5,200 in the customer's favor.

notes.author: James Rodriguez
notes.text: Adjusted invoices issued with correct FX rate. Billing system updated to use contracted rate.

title: Summit Energy - Auto-Renewal Escalation Not Applied
description: Summit's contract auto-renewed without the 4% annual price escalation specified in the agreement
rootCause: Price escalation clause not linked to auto-renewal workflow in contract management system
aiExplanation: Summit's contract renewed February 1, 2024 at the original $28,000/month rate. The 4% annual escalation should have brought the rate to $29,120/month, creating a $1,120/month shortfall over 12 months.

activityLog.detail: Reviewing contract renewal terms with legal

title: Ironclad Security - Unapproved SIEM Discount
description: A 20% discretionary discount was applied to Ironclad's SIEM Integration without manager approval
rootCause: Sales rep applied discretionary discount exceeding their $10,000 approval authority
aiExplanation: A 20% discount ($14,300 annual impact) was applied to Ironclad's SIEM Integration line item. The sales rep's discount authority is limited to 10% or $10,000 whichever is less. No manager approval record exists.

notes.author: Emily Watson
notes.text: Escalated to VP Sales for retroactive approval or clawback decision.

activityLog.detail: No approval record found in workflow system

title: Trident Maritime - Duplicate Tax Charge
description: Trident invoices show both Singapore GST and US sales tax applied incorrectly
aiExplanation: Initial analysis flagged dual tax charges on Trident invoices. Investigation confirmed that the Singapore GST applies to the Singapore-hosted infrastructure component while US sales tax applies to the US-based SaaS component, per the split-jurisdiction billing arrangement.

notes.author: Michael Torres
notes.text: Dual tax application is correct per split-jurisdiction arrangement confirmed by tax counsel.

title: Velocity Sports - Price Increase Not Communicated
description: Annual platform price increase of 5% was applied without the required 90-day advance notice
rootCause: Price increase notification email was not sent due to marketing automation error
aiExplanation: Velocity's contract requires 90-day notice before price changes. The 5% increase effective August 1 was applied without notification. The customer disputed the $300/month increase and was entitled to a rollback for the notice period.

notes.author: James Rodriguez
notes.text: Rolled back price increase for Aug-Oct. New increase effective November with proper notice.

activityLog.detail: Credit issued for Aug-Oct increase amount
Amount credited and proper notice sent

title: Apex Consulting - Contract SLA Credit Overissued
description: SLA credit issued to Apex exceeded the contractual maximum of one month's fees
rootCause: SLA credit calculation used annual value instead of monthly value as the cap
aiExplanation: Apex's CRM Integration contract caps SLA credits at one month's fees ($7,200). A credit of $14,400 (two months) was issued for a September outage. The excess $7,200 should be reversed.

notes.author: Emily Watson
notes.text: Excess credit reversed on November invoice. Customer acknowledged the correction.

activityLog.detail: $7,200 excess credit reversed on November invoice
